entries.english: B (b): Baba athĩĩ kwĩ borithi (father has gone to the police), Banga inđo wega ũhũre nguo baathi (arrange things well and iron the clothes). C (c): Cũcũ cera gwitũ kaingĩ (grandmother, visit us often), Mũcemi cookia kĩũria (Mũcemi, answer the question). Nđ (nđ/d): Ĩkĩra iratũ cia kobo ũthĩĩ nđoro-inĩ (put on gumboots and walk over the mud), Nđongoro nĩ kanyamũ kanini (a slug is a small animal), Nđongu ĩno nđungu nĩ nđũrũ (this big sodom apple is bitter)

Pattern: Verb + ũtana/mũtana + verb. Singular: Nyua maĩ ũtanarĩa irio (drink water before you eat food), Wĩthambe ũtanauma nja (shower before you go out), Hũra thimũ ũtaneka ũndũ ũngĩ (make a call before you do something else). Plural: Nyuai maĩ mũtanarĩa irio (drink water before you eat - plural), Mwĩthambei mũtanuma nja (shower before you go out - plural), Thomithiai ciana citananeheha (teach the children before they grow up)
